concept.title: Partition Prefix
concept.shortdesc: You can use a partition prefix to organize data by partitions. You can use the partition prefix to write to existing partitions or to create new partitions as needed. When a partition specified in the partition prefix does not exist, Amazon S3 creates the partition.

conbody.p: Amazon S3 destinationpartition prefixpartition prefixAmazon S3 destinationYou can specify an exact partition name for the partition prefix, or you can use an expression that evaluates to a partition name.
For example, to write data to partitions based on data in the Country field, you can use the following expression as the partition prefix: ${record:value('/Country')}.
With this expression, the destination writes records to partitions based on the country data in the record, and creates partitions for countries that do not already have a partition.
